result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Archie Anthony Talley

records.addlTxt: COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Haley E Wentz in court.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a Plea/Sentencing hearing. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO JUDGE. Court further takes no action as to bail..

Defendant Archie Anthony Talley in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Court vacates stayed bench warrant. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Court authorizes transfer of misdemeanor cases for global resolution. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Haley E Wentz in court.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Case scheduled for scheduling conference.  Defendant failing to appear.  Defense counsel requests that the Court impose and stay a warrant.  State has no objection. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date. At State's request, defendant to appear in-person, room G55 CJF, at next court date.  Calendar call scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Archie Anthony Talley in court with Attorney Haley E Wentz.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Imposed and stayed warrant is cancelled. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Archie Anthony Talley not in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case was set for a preliminary hearing 4/8/2022. Attorney Wentz contacted the court to get a new date due to attending the Race Conference. Defendant was not present on 4/8/2022 to get the new date. Court will impose and stay a warrant until the next date. Return on warrant date has been vacated. Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Return on warrant on April 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 750.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Archie Anthony Talley not in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a preliminary hearing. State's witness is present. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO JUDGE. Court further orders that bail is forfeited. Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with GRR.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No driving, regardless if the Defendant has a valid license.
Cooperate with JusticePoint ordered in other cases.

Defendant Archie Anthony Talley in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 2.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
